content.raw:
I just noticed that I get a CORS warning when loading the ambulance model:

~~~
Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/72c89564-882a-4bce-8bf5-ba7075c06d6a/suv/materials/textures/wheels_01.png. (Reason: CORS header ‘Access-Control-Allow-Origin’ missing).
~~~

that's probably a ignition-fuel response header problem?
content.html:

content.raw: I think this will need a deeper look once we want to have better support for things like `model://`. I don't want to block this any longer, I'll just fix the test, improve the example a bit and wait for @iche033's approval.
content.html: I think this will need a deeper look once we want to have better support for things like model://. I don't want to block this any longer, I'll just fix the test, improve the example a bit and wait for @iche033's approval.

content.raw: Ahh the test is currently failing exactly because staging.ignitionfuel is offline.
content.html: Ahh the test is currently failing exactly because staging.ignitionfuel is offline.

Most of pull request #141 has been merged as part of other pull requests! This PR is now down to the custom URLs functionality.

One thing which concerns me about this approach is that the full path to every resource must be added explicitly. I think we could try an alternative approach, which is closer to how Gazebo works, of adding resource paths instead.

So instead of doing this:

sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/model.sdf);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/rudder.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/right_flap.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/right_aileron.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/left_flap.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/left_aileron.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/elevators.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/cessna_rear_right_wheel.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/cessna_rear_left_wheel.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/cessna_prop.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/cessna_front_wheel.dae);
sdfparser.addUrl(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/meshes/body.dae);

You could do just this for example:

sdfparser.addPath(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/)
sdfparser.load(https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/models/57d63c5f-0fd7-4540-b045-33a0a361fa86/files/model.sdf);

Granted, this is not exactly like GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, because the path given goes straight to the model root instead of the parent directory of all models, so we'd still need to add a separate path for each model. But given Ignition Fuel's URL format, I can't see a better way of handling this unless we reimplement ignition-fuel-tools in Javascript
